bug.author: monchier
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
The installTracer option in the Streamlit config does not do anything but slowing down the script to the point it is unusable. On top of this, there is no documentation on how to use this feature. We should fix (or remove, if deemed obsolete) and add docuemntation. <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
Turn on installTracer in the Streamlit config. Run a script. <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
I am expecting at least that the script runs, may with a little performance overhead. <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
Script's state says "Running" forever. <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
yes <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: (get it with $ streamlit version) Python version: (get it with $ python --version) Using Conda? PipEnv? PyEnv? Pex? OS version: Browser version:
<denchmark-h:h1>Additional information</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://discuss.streamlit.io/t/how-to-use-tracer/759/2>https://discuss.streamlit.io/t/how-to-use-tracer/759/2</denchmark-link>
